com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.manager

Class EMXConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.sessionmanager.DefaultClientConnectionManager
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.manager.EMXConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IClientConnectionManager, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public class EMXConnectionManager
extends DefaultClientConnectionManager
    A ConnectionManager that is specially constructed for managing a connection to EMX.
    Author:
    John Cameron, Christopher J Burton, 02/Jun/2002.

    • Method Detail

      • openComponent

        public boolean openComponent()
                      throws Exception
        Opens and configures the EMXConnectionManager. Configuration should be performed in the openComponent() method. We need to ensure that we have a KeyStoreManager and that the KeyStoreManager has configured the SSLSocketConnection, since the Application Server will need all of this to be in place when it tries to create a connection for us.
        Specified by:
        openComponent in interface IComponent
        Overrides:
        openComponent in class DefaultClientConnectionManager
        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
        Exception - if it is unable to properly configure itself.

      • getKeyStoreManagerInstance

        public static KeyStoreManager getKeyStoreManagerInstance(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint,
                                                         IConnectionPointConfiguration connectionPointConfiguration)
                                                  throws Exception
        This static helper method does everything that is needed to set up a KeyStoreManager. It can be called by other EMX adapter classes to ensure that a KeyStoreManager instance has been properly set up.
        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - connection point
        connectionPointConfiguration - connection point configuration
        Returns:
        The KeyStoreManager instance to be used for the supplied party.
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of a missing party attribute

      • createLogonMessage

        protected IFIXMessage createLogonMessage()
                                  throws Exception
        Returns a LogonMessage that will be sent to the other party (EMX). This method must be implemented by the ConnectionManager if we want to supply a custom Logon message, which we must do for EMX, since it requires us to supply the client's certificate.
        Overrides:
        createLogonMessage in class DefaultClientConnectionManager
        Returns:
        The LogonMessage that will be sent to EMX.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • onException

        protected boolean onException(Exception e)
        This method is called whenever any exception occurs while the DefaultClientConnectionManager is trying to start our session. We delegate the analysis of the exception to our helper. We must return true if we wish the connection attempt to continue. If we return false, the DefaultClientConnectionManager's run() method will terminate. Note also that the DefaultClientConnectionManager calls onException if an exception, even a non-fatal one, occurs during the Logon process. We will always return true when we get a non-fatal exception.
        Overrides:
        onException in class DefaultClientConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        e - exception
        Returns:
        true if we want to continue, false otherwise.

      • decideShouldReconnect

        protected boolean decideShouldReconnect()
        Based on our current connection status, should we try to reconnect or should we prefer to give up trying and stop?. A subclass of EMXConnectionManager can implement this method to return different behaviour.
        Returns:
        whether we should try to reconnect or prefer to give up trying and stop

      • onResponse

        protected boolean onResponse(IFIXMessage response)
        This method returns to us the response to our Logon message. If all is well, we will get a Logon. If we get anything else we need to investigate the problem and recover where possible. We must return a shouldContinue indicator. If set to true then the DefaultClientConnectionManager will keep looking for a Logon response until one is received. If set to false then this Logon attempt will be abandoned.
        Overrides:
        onResponse in class DefaultClientConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        Returns:
        true

      • onStartConnect

        protected void onStartConnect()
        This hook is provided for actions that must be taken before we try to connect. We pass this call straight through to our helper.
        Overrides:
        onStartConnect in class DefaultClientConnectionManager

      • onStartLogon

        protected void onStartLogon(IFIXMessage logonMessage)
        This method gets called just before the Logon message gets sent. Note that the logonMessage passed to it will be the message that our own getLogonMessage() method returns.
        Overrides:
        onStartLogon in class DefaultClientConnectionManager

      • endOfSession

        public void endOfSession()
        This method is called back from the helper and allows us to indicate whether the Application Server should or should not try to reconnect.
